abstract: The private equity titans discuss the lack of big buyouts and the perception of the industry in the United States and abroad. And one predicts boom years for the sector if Mitt Romney is elected.
snippet: The private equity titans discuss the lack of big buyouts and the perception of the industry in the United States and abroad. And one predicts boom years for the sector if Mitt Romney is elected.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The Milken Institute Global Conference happened to coincide with May 1, the day Occupy Wall Street picked to reinvigorate its ranks with a series of marches and protests across the country. Inside the financier-filled Beverly Hilton here, though, the Occupy movement seemed a world away.

headline.main: Buyout Kings Size Up Their Sector, the Elections and Europe
